intro: Anoda denudata, commonly known as the nakedleaf morning glory, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and can be either ovate or lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are typically blue to violet in color, opening in the morning and closing by midday. Anoda denudata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
